solution_line_template: A {discount_percentage} discount on each kilogram of apples would mean the price being {discount_percentage} * {price_per_kg} = $<<{discount_percentage}*{price_per_kg}={discount_amount_per_kg}>>{discount_amount_per_kg} smaller.

So one kilogram of apples would cost not ${price_per_kg}, but {price_per_kg} - {discount_amount_per_kg} = $<<{price_per_kg}-{discount_amount_per_kg}={discounted_price_per_kg}>>{discounted_price_per_kg}.
So for {quantity_kg} kilograms of apples Hannah would pay {discounted_price_per_kg} * {quantity_kg} = $<<{discounted_price_per_kg}*{quantity_kg}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
